name: gatk3_human_exome_pipeline
title: GATK3 Human Exome Pipeline
summary: v1.3 - (Requires a user-provided GATK 3.x jar file). Implements the GATK 3.x best practices pipeline for human exomes, including deduplicating, realigning and recalibrating mappings, and calling variants.

inputSpec.name: sorted_bam
inputSpec.label: Sorted mappings
inputSpec.help: A coordinate-sorted BAM file with the human mappings to be processed through the pipeline.

inputSpec.name: vendor_exome_bedfile
inputSpec.label: Vendor exome bedfile
inputSpec.help: Select the bed file which will be used to filter by haplotype caller. If a custom panel this input will not be downloaded.

inputSpec.name: padding
inputSpec.label: Extra padding to add to targets
inputSpec.help: The amount of padding, in number of bases, to add to each target interval. This is typically used to add padding around exons when analyzing exomes. The general Broad exome calling pipeline uses 100 bp padding by default. This will supply the '-ip' command-line option to GATK HaplotypeCaller. This option is ignored if no vendor exome is selected. Enter 0 to disable padding.

inputSpec.name: output_format
inputSpec.label: Output format
inputSpec.help: Choose 'vcf' to output a regular (genotyped) VCF file. Choose 'gvcf' to output an intermediate gVCF file which can be later genotyped. Choose 'both' to output both types of files. For more information on the gVCF file format, see http://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/discussion/4017/what-is-a-gvcf-and-how-is-it-different-from-a-regular-vcf.

inputSpec.name: skip_markduplicates
inputSpec.label: Skip the duplicate marking step?
inputSpec.help: If selected, the duplicate marking step will be skipped. This is appropriate if the input BAM file contains already-marked duplicates by some other method, or if the protocol requires skipping this step (typical for HaloPlex).

inputSpec.name: extra_md_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for Picard MarkDuplicates)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the Picard MarkDuplicates execution. Example: REMOVE_DUPLICATES=true

inputSpec.name: extra_rtc_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for RealignerTargetCreator)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK RealignerTargetCreator execution. Example: -minReads 6

inputSpec.name: extra_ir_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for IndelRealigner)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK IndelRealigner execution. Example: -LOD 0.4

inputSpec.name: extra_br_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for BaseRecalibrator)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK BaseRecalibrator execution. Example: -maxCycle 100

inputSpec.name: extra_pr_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for PrintReads)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK PrintReads execution. Example: --downsample_coverage 500

inputSpec.name: extra_hc_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for HaplotypeCaller)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK HaplotypeCaller execution. Example: -stand_call_conf 20

inputSpec.name: extra_gg_options
inputSpec.label: Extra command line options (for GenotypeGVCFs)
inputSpec.help: Extra command line options that will be supplied directly to the GATK GenotypeGVCFs execution. Example: -maxAltAlleles 10

outputSpec.name: bam
outputSpec.label: Refined mappings (BAM)
outputSpec.help: A coordinate-sorted BAM file with the refined mappings.

outputSpec.name: outputmetrics
outputSpec.label: Mark Duplicates Output Metrics
outputSpec.help: The outputmetrics  files from picard mark duplicates.

outputSpec.name: vcf
outputSpec.label: Variants (VCF)
outputSpec.help: A gzipped VCF file with the called variants.

outputSpec.name: vcf_tbi
outputSpec.label: Variants (VCF) index
outputSpec.help: A tabix index (TBI) file with the associated variants index.

outputSpec.name: gvcf
outputSpec.label: Variants (gVCF)
outputSpec.help: A gzipped gVCF file with the called variants.

outputSpec.name: gvcf_tbi
outputSpec.label: Variants (gVCF) index
outputSpec.help: A tabix index (TBI) file with the associated variants index.

details.whatsNew:
* 1.0.5: Markdown fix in documentation
* 1.0.4: GATK .jar file is now a required input. Allowing the applet to work with any version of GATK3.x, including GATK3.6.
* 1.0.3: Adding Agilent SureSelect Human All Exon v6
* 1.0.2: Bug fixes
* 1.0.1: Adding explicit tabix indexing for older GATK versions
